messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest 3441-Late talkers!
messages.messageBody:
>>>He pretty much grunted and pointed then suddenly began speaking in
sentences.
Julie<<<

LOL! That's what I keep telling everyone! (And myself occasionally!) My
husband and I were talking about this last night (he's worried) and I told
him I bet he will rue the day he ever complained! Our 2 yr old and 6 yr old
talk our heads off! My friends son didn't talk until right after his second
birthday, then he came up to her one day and said, 'I wanna go to Grandma's
house!'. I was on the ohone with her when he said it. It was SO funny! He
had only ever said Mama before and that was it! I expect that Caeleb, too,
will bypass single and double word sentences for paragraphs.

Thanks for all the comments. Sometimes, after a long spell of my husband's
doubts, I begin to doubt myself and just need some reassurance. The baby
was up all night last night, so I guess I had a LOT of time on my hands to
worry about everything!

Jennifer

messages.subject: Digest 3441-Late talkers!
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Jennifer; I wanted to say that my baby, my son, didn t really talk til he was about 3. When you re the baby, why would ya need to? I assumed he would, he
messages.messageBody:
Hi Jennifer;
I wanted to say that my baby, my son, didn't really talk til he was about 3. When you're the baby, why would ya need to? I assumed he would, he did and does...my 2 cents.
Robyn
